--- title: "Fits and characterizes final model for 4-week outcome" author: "Gaylen Fronk" date: "2024-05-27" output: html_document: toc: true toc_depth: 4 params: study: "match" version: "v5" cv: "kfold" y_col_name: "pp_hybrid_wk4_outcome" format: html: embed-resources: true editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ### Set Up Environment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} study <- params$study version <- params$version cv <- params$cv y_col_name <- params$y_col_name ``` ::: Packages for script ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(tidymodels) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels 1.2.0 ── ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ✔ broom 1.0.5 ✔ recipes 1.0.10 ✔ dials 1.2.1 ✔ rsample 1.2.1 ✔ dplyr 1.1.4 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ ggplot2 3.5.1 ✔ tidyr 1.3.1 ✔ infer 1.0.7 ✔ tune 1.2.1 ✔ modeldata 1.3.0 ✔ workflows 1.1.4 ✔ parsnip 1.2.1 ✔ workflowsets 1.1.0 ✔ purrr 1.0.2 ✔ yardstick 1.3.1 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels_conflicts() ── ✖ purrr::discard() masks scales::discard() ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ✖ recipes::step() masks stats::step() • Use suppressPackageStartupMessages() to eliminate package startup messages ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ readr 2.1.5 ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ stringr 1.5.1 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ readr::col_factor() masks scales::col_factor() ✖ purrr::discard() masks scales::discard() ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ stringr::fixed() masks recipes::fixed() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ✖ readr::spec() masks yardstick::spec() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(Matrix) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Attaching package: 'Matrix' The following objects are masked from 'package:tidyr': expand, pack, unpack ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(probably) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Attaching package: 'probably' The following objects are masked from 'package:base': as.factor, as.ordered ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(here) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` here() starts at C:/Users/gfronk/Documents/GitHub/study_match ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false devtools::source_url("https://github.com/jjcurtin/lab_support/blob/main/fun_eda.R?raw=true") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ℹ SHA-1 hash of file is "c045eee2655a18dc85e715b78182f176327358a7" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false devtools::source_url("https://github.com/jjcurtin/lab_support/blob/main/chtc/static_files/fun_chtc.R?raw=true") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ℹ SHA-1 hash of file is "b58b9e0adc05e89609ee8bc6f20c39375b262fe6" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false theme_set(theme_classic()) ``` ::: Handle conflicts ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false options(conflicts.policy = "depends.ok") ``` ::: Absolute paths ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} switch (Sys.info()[['sysname']], # PC paths Windows = { path_input <- stringr::str_c("P:/studydata/match/chtc/", y_col_name) path_models <- stringr::str_c("P:/studydata/match/models/", y_col_name)}, # IOS paths Darwin = { path_input <- stringr::str_c("/Volumes/private/studydata/match/chtc/", y_col_name) path_models <- stringr::str_c("/Volumes/private/studydata/match/models/", y_col_name)}, # Linux paths Linux = { path_input <- stringr::str_c("~/mnt/private/studydata/match/chtc/", y_col_name) path_models <- stringr::str_c("~/mnt/private/studydata/match/models/", y_col_name)} ) ``` ::: Chunk Defaults ::: {.cell .hidden} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| include: false knitr::opts_chunk$set(attr.output='style="max-height: 500px;"') options(tibble.width = Inf) options(tibble.print_max = Inf) ``` ::: ### Read in best configuration Selected in 1_metrics_inner (k-fold CV) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} best_config <- read_csv(file.path(path_models, str_c("best_config_none_", version, ".csv")), show_col_types = FALSE) glimpse(best_config) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} Rows: 1 Columns: 14 $ n_jobs 10 $ algorithm "glmnet" $ feature_set "item_ordinal" $ hp1 0.8 $ hp2 0.02656553 $ hp3 NA $ resample "none" $ accuracy 0.7110092 $ bal_accuracy 0.5974326 $ roc_auc 0.7268278 $ sens 0.2625762 $ spec 0.9182367 $ ppv 0.5753676 $ npv 0.7049689 ``` ::: ::: ### Fit best model in full dataset **NOTE**: This model will only be used for 1) examining parameter estimates, and 2) ultimate dissemination. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} batch_names <- list.dirs(path_input, full.names = FALSE, recursive = FALSE) batch_name <- batch_names[str_detect(batch_names, "train") & str_detect(batch_names, cv) & str_detect(batch_names, version) & str_detect(batch_names, best_config$algorithm)] path_batch <- file.path(path_input, batch_name) source(file.path(path_batch, "input", "training_controls.R")) d <- read_csv(file.path(path_batch, "input", "data_trn.csv"), show_col_types = FALSE) d_outcomes <- d |> select(subid, ends_with("outcome") & contains("hybrid")) d <- format_data(d) rec <- build_recipe(d = d, config = best_config) rec_prepped_full <- rec |> prep(training = d, strings_as_factors = FALSE) feat_all <- rec_prepped_full |> bake(new_data = NULL) model_best_full <- fit_best_model(best_model = best_config, feat = feat_all, ml_mode = "classification") ``` ::: ### Model coefficients **NOTE**: Coefficients are naturally inverted (i.e., positive class [abstinence] treated as first [vs. second] class). Here, we multiply coefficients by -1 to align the direction of coefficients with the rest of our analyses. Once flipped (i.e., as they appear below)... A *positive coefficient* indicates that increases in the feature *increase* the likelihood of abstinence. For example, increases in motivation to quit ("motive_quit_order") *increase* the likelihood of abstinence. A *negative coefficient* indicates that increases in the feature *decrease* the likelihood of smoking. For example, increases in carbon monoxide ("co") *decrease* the likelihood of abstinence. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} model_tidy <- tidy(model_best_full) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Loaded glmnet 4.1-8 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#tbl-retained-vars-4wk .cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| label: tbl-retained-vars-4wk retained_vars <- model_tidy |> mutate(estimate = estimate * -1) |> filter(abs(estimate) > 0) |> select(-penalty) |> arrange(desc(abs(estimate))) print_kbl(retained_vars, digits = 4) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
term estimate

race_ehr_white 0.2600

wsws_stressed_24h_item_order -0.0006
treatment_varenicline_x_psych_depression_yes 0.0001

````` ::: ::: 4.09% of features were retained by the glmnet solution (48 features of a total considered 1173 features). ::: {#tbl-retained-tx-4wk .cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| label: tbl-retained-tx-4wk retained_vars_tx <- retained_vars |> filter(str_detect(term, "treatment_")) |> arrange(desc(abs(estimate))) print_kbl(retained_vars_tx, digits = 4) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
term estimate
treatment_combo_nrt_x_live_with_smoker_live_alone_or_only_with_partner 0.1066
treatment_combo_nrt_x_wisdm37_22_item_order -0.0788
treatment_combo_nrt_x_race_ehr_black_african_american -0.0686
treatment_varenicline_x_live_with_smoker_live_alone_or_only_with_partner -0.0668
treatment_combo_nrt_x_smoke_menthol_no 0.0443
treatment_patch_x_used_cigars_never_tried -0.0273
treatment_patch_x_close_smoke_friend_no -0.0263
treatment_varenicline_x_used_cigars_never_tried 0.0199
treatment_combo_nrt_x_dsm5_10_item_yes -0.0111
treatment_varenicline_x_spouse_smoke_no 0.0105
treatment_combo_nrt_x_marital_status_ehr_married 0.0067
treatment_varenicline_x_psych_depression_yes 0.0001
treatment_combo_nrt_x_marital_status_ehr_divorced 0.0000
treatment_patch_x_close_smoke_co_worker_yes 0.0000
````` ::: ::: 29.17% of the retained features were treatment interaction features (14 treatment features of 48 retained features). Of the 877 available treatment interaction features, 2% were retained. ### Calculate and calibrate probabilities Make triplicate dataset ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_patch <- d |> mutate(treatment = "patch") d_combo <- d |> mutate(treatment = "combo_nrt") d_varen <- d |> mutate(treatment = "varenicline") d_trip <- bind_rows(d_patch, d_combo) |> bind_rows(d_varen) |> mutate(treatment = factor(treatment, levels = c( "patch", "varenicline", "combo_nrt"))) ``` ::: Make function to: 1) hold out each sub once, 2) fit model with remaining 1085 subs, 3) get 3 raw predictions for held-out sub, 4) get calibrated predictions for held-out sub ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} get_triple_probs <- function(i_sub, best_config, d, d_trip){ # hold out single subject d_out <- d_trip |> filter(subid == i_sub) d_in <- d |> filter(subid != i_sub) # prep recipe rec <- build_recipe(d = d_in, config = best_config) rec_prepped <- rec |> prep(training = d_in, strings_as_factors = FALSE) # bake feat_in and feat_out feat_in <- rec_prepped |> bake(new_data = NULL) feat_out <- rec_prepped |> bake(new_data = d_out) # fit model model_best <- fit_best_model(best_config, feat = feat_in, "classification") # raw (uncalibrated) predictions preds_prob <- predict(model_best, feat_out, type = "prob") # fit calibration model set.seed(2468) cal_split <- d_in |> initial_split(prop = 3/4, strata = y) d_cal_in <- training(cal_split) d_cal_out <- testing(cal_split) rec_cal_prepped <- rec |> prep(training = d_cal_in, strings_as_factors = FALSE) feat_cal_in <- rec_cal_prepped |> bake(new_data = NULL) feat_cal_out <- rec_cal_prepped |> bake(new_data = d_cal_out) model_cal <- fit_best_model(best_config, feat = feat_cal_in, "classification") # beta calibration beta <- predict(model_cal, feat_cal_out, type = "prob") |> mutate(truth = feat_cal_out$y) |> cal_estimate_beta(truth = truth, estimate = dplyr::starts_with(".pred_"), smooth = TRUE) preds_prob_beta <- preds_prob |> cal_apply(beta) # iso calibration iso <- predict(model_cal, feat_cal_out, type = "prob") |> mutate(truth = feat_cal_out$y) |> cal_estimate_isotonic(truth = truth, estimate = dplyr::starts_with(".pred_")) preds_prob_iso <- preds_prob |> cal_apply(iso) # logistic calibration logi <- predict(model_cal, feat_cal_out, type = "prob") |> mutate(truth = feat_cal_out$y) |> cal_estimate_logistic(truth = truth, estimate = dplyr::starts_with(".pred_"), smooth = TRUE) preds_prob_logi <- preds_prob |> cal_apply(logi) # combine raw and calibrated probs probs <- tibble(subid = d_out$subid, tx = d_out$treatment, prob_raw = preds_prob[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]], prob_beta = preds_prob_beta[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]], prob_iso = preds_prob_iso[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]], prob_logi = preds_prob_logi[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]]) } ``` ::: Map over participants so that each is held-out once ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} if(file.exists(file.path(path_models, str_c("trip_probs_none_", version, ".csv")))) { all_probs <- read_csv(file.path(path_models, str_c("trip_probs_none_", version, ".csv")), show_col_types = FALSE) } else { all_probs <- d$subid |> map(\(i_sub) get_triple_probs(i_sub, best_config, d, d_trip)) |> list_rbind() all_probs |> write_csv(file.path(path_models, str_c("trip_probs_none_", version, ".csv"))) } ``` ::: ### Make AIM 2 Dataset Pivot probabilities into wide format & select only raw probability (based on calibration validity check below) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} raw_probs_wide <- all_probs |> select(subid, tx, prob_raw) |> pivot_wider(names_prefix = "prob_", names_from = tx, values_from = prob_raw) glimpse(raw_probs_wide) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} Rows: 1,086 Columns: 4 $ subid 20010, 20015, 20030, 20049, 20051, 20072, 20077, 2008… $ prob_patch 0.2093074, 0.4650573, 0.2365512, 0.4136924, 0.3364847… $ prob_combo_nrt 0.1969431, 0.4954341, 0.3381514, 0.3884661, 0.3973405… $ prob_varenicline 0.2344881, 0.5109733, 0.2365676, 0.4440759, 0.3941199… ``` ::: ::: Join with d & create new variables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} set.seed(52592) d_aim_2 <- d |> select(subid, tx_rct = treatment, outcome_rct_wk4 = y) |> left_join(raw_probs_wide, by = "subid") |> mutate(tx_best = case_when( prob_patch > prob_combo_nrt & prob_patch > prob_varenicline ~ "patch", prob_combo_nrt > prob_patch & prob_combo_nrt > prob_varenicline ~ "combo_nrt", prob_varenicline > prob_patch & prob_varenicline > prob_combo_nrt ~ "varenicline", TRUE ~ NA_character_ )) |> # handle ties (prefer CNRT and varenicline per clinical guidelines) # sample among those if tied mutate(tx_best = if_else(is.na(tx_best), case_when( prob_patch == prob_combo_nrt ~ "combo_nrt", prob_patch == prob_varenicline ~ "varenicline", prob_combo_nrt == prob_varenicline ~ sample(c("combo_nrt", "varenicline"), 1), TRUE ~ NA_character_ ), tx_best)) |> mutate(prob_best = case_when( tx_best == "patch" ~ prob_patch, tx_best == "combo_nrt" ~ prob_combo_nrt, tx_best == "varenicline" ~ prob_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ )) |> mutate(tx_best = factor(tx_best, levels = c( "patch", "varenicline", "combo_nrt"))) |> mutate(tx_match = if_else(tx_best == tx_rct, TRUE, FALSE)) |> left_join(d_outcomes, by = "subid") |> select(-pp_hybrid_wk4_outcome, -pp_hybrid_wk1_outcome, -pp_hybrid_yr3_outcome, -pp_hybrid_wk52_outcome) |> rename(outcome_rct_wk12 = pp_hybrid_wk12_outcome, outcome_rct_wk26 = pp_hybrid_wk26_outcome) |> relocate(subid, tx_rct, tx_best, tx_match, prob_best, starts_with("outcome"), starts_with("prob")) glimpse(d_aim_2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} Rows: 1,086 Columns: 11 $ subid 20010, 20015, 20030, 20049, 20051, 20072, 20077, 2008… $ tx_rct patch, combo_nrt, patch, varenicline, patch, combo_nr… $ tx_best varenicline, varenicline, combo_nrt, varenicline, com… $ tx_match FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE,… $ prob_best 0.2344881, 0.5109733, 0.3381514, 0.4440759, 0.3973405… $ outcome_rct_wk4 smoking, smoking, smoking, smoking, smoking, smoking,… $ outcome_rct_wk12 "smoking", "smoking", "smoking", "abstinent", "smokin… $ outcome_rct_wk26 "smoking", "smoking", "smoking", "abstinent", "smokin… $ prob_patch 0.2093074, 0.4650573, 0.2365512, 0.4136924, 0.3364847… $ prob_combo_nrt 0.1969431, 0.4954341, 0.3381514, 0.3884661, 0.3973405… $ prob_varenicline 0.2344881, 0.5109733, 0.2365676, 0.4440759, 0.3941199… ``` ::: ::: Quick EDA checks ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # confirm logic worked as expected head(d_aim_2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 6 × 11 subid tx_rct tx_best tx_match prob_best outcome_rct_wk4 1 20010 patch varenicline FALSE 0.234 smoking 2 20015 combo_nrt varenicline FALSE 0.511 smoking 3 20030 patch combo_nrt FALSE 0.338 smoking 4 20049 varenicline varenicline TRUE 0.444 smoking 5 20051 patch combo_nrt FALSE 0.397 smoking 6 20072 combo_nrt combo_nrt TRUE 0.344 smoking outcome_rct_wk12 outcome_rct_wk26 prob_patch prob_combo_nrt prob_varenicline 1 smoking smoking 0.209 0.197 0.234 2 smoking smoking 0.465 0.495 0.511 3 smoking smoking 0.237 0.338 0.237 4 abstinent abstinent 0.414 0.388 0.444 5 smoking smoking 0.336 0.397 0.394 6 smoking smoking 0.319 0.344 0.325 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # check on variability of best tx d_aim_2 |> tab(tx_best) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 3 × 3 tx_best n prop 1 patch 18 0.0166 2 varenicline 693 0.638 3 combo_nrt 375 0.345 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # check on variability of tx matching d_aim_2 |> tab(tx_match) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 2 × 3 tx_match n prop 1 FALSE 634 0.584 2 TRUE 452 0.416 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # variability of matching within assigned (RCT) tx d_aim_2 |> group_by(tx_rct) |> tab(tx_match) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 6 × 4 # Groups: tx_rct [3] tx_rct tx_match n prop 1 patch FALSE 235 0.975 2 patch TRUE 6 0.0249 3 varenicline FALSE 136 0.321 4 varenicline TRUE 288 0.679 5 combo_nrt FALSE 263 0.625 6 combo_nrt TRUE 158 0.375 ``` ::: ::: Write out ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_aim_2 |> write_csv(file.path(path_models, str_c("aim_2_", version, "_none_", y_col_name, ".csv"))) ``` ::: ### Validity check: Model Calibration Make wide format for all calibrated probabilities ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} all_probs_wide <- all_probs |> rename_with(~ str_replace(.x, "prob_", ""), .cols = starts_with("prob_")) |> pivot_wider( names_from = tx, values_from = c(raw, beta, iso, logi), names_glue = "{.value}_{tx}" ) ``` ::: Set up validity check data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_valid <- d_aim_2 |> select(subid, tx_rct, outcome_rct_wk4) |> left_join(all_probs_wide, by = "subid") |> mutate(beta = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ beta_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ beta_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ beta_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ ), raw = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ raw_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ raw_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ raw_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ ), isotonic = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ iso_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ iso_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ iso_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ ), logistic = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ logi_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ logi_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ logi_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ )) |> select(subid, outcome_rct_wk4, beta, raw, isotonic, logistic) ``` ::: #### Comparison of means Compare mean abstinence from RCT to predicted probabilities for RCT tx across calibrations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_valid |> mutate(outcome_rct = if_else(outcome_rct_wk4 == "abstinent", 1, 0)) |> summarize(mean_rct = mean(outcome_rct), mean_beta = mean(beta), mean_iso = mean(isotonic), mean_logi = mean(logistic), mean_raw = mean(raw)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 1 × 5 mean_rct mean_beta mean_iso mean_logi mean_raw 1 0.342 0.352 0.263 0.356 0.342 ``` ::: ::: Raw probabilities match best, though beta and logistic calibration are close. #### Plots Pivot data longer for required format ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_plot <- d_valid |> pivot_longer( cols = c(beta, raw, isotonic, logistic), names_to = "method", values_to = ".pred_abstinent" ) ``` ::: Make plots by calibration method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_plot |> cal_plot_breaks(truth = outcome_rct_wk4, estimate = .pred_abstinent, .by = method) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](fit_final_model_4wk_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_plot |> cal_plot_windowed(truth = outcome_rct_wk4, estimate = .pred_abstinent, .by = method) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](fit_final_model_4wk_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: Raw and beta look best. Raw follows the diagonal more closely for longer. #### Brier score Beta calibration ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} brier_class_vec(truth = d_valid$outcome_rct_wk4, estimate = d_valid$beta) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} [1] 0.2025098 ``` ::: ::: Logistic calibration ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} brier_class_vec(truth = d_valid$outcome_rct_wk4, estimate = d_valid$logistic) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} [1] 0.2069449 ``` ::: ::: Isotonic calibration ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} brier_class_vec(truth = d_valid$outcome_rct_wk4, estimate = d_valid$isotonic) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} [1] 0.2199579 ``` ::: ::: Raw calibration ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} brier_class_vec(truth = d_valid$outcome_rct_wk4, estimate = d_valid$raw) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} [1] 0.1987691 ``` ::: ::: Raw calibration has the lowest Brier score (though all are relatively similar). In keeping with the other methods above, beta and logistic are next-best followed by isotonic last.
